DataElement.preferredDefinition: The code that represents the information pertaining to protocol EC10144 in which subsets of a defined population are identified.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to studies in which subsets of a defined population are identified. These groups may or may not be exposed to factors hypothesized to influence the probability of the occurrence of a particular disease or other outcome. Cohorts are defined populations which, as a whole, are followed in an attempt to determine distinguishing subgroup characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: Studies in which subsets of a defined population are identified. These groups may or may not be exposed to factors hypothesized to influence the probability of the occurrence of a particular disease or other outcome. Cohorts are defined populations which, as a whole, are followed in an attempt to determine distinguishing subgroup characteristics.

Concepts.definition: A research study that compares a particular outcome (such as lung cancer) in groups of individuals who are alike in many ways but differ by a certain characteristic (for example, female nurses who smoke compared with those who do not smoke).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A laboratory test result that indicates the status of a molecular genetic or cytogenetic event in a pathologic process._A research study that compares a particular outcome (such as lung cancer) in groups of individuals who are alike in many ways but differ by a certain characteristic (for example, female nurses who smoke compared with those who do not smoke)._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cohort 1: Patients with BRCA1, BRCA2, ATM, BAP1, MSH2, PALB2, and BRIP1 or high TMB
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cohort 1: Patients with BRCA1, BRCA2, ATM, BAP1, MSH2, PALB2, and BRIP1 or high TMB

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cohort 2: Patients with other DNA-repair genes tested in the FoundationOne panel excluding BRCA1, BRCA2, ATM, BAP1, MSH2, PALB2, and BRIP1 without high TMB
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cohort 2: Patients with other DNA-repair genes tested in the FoundationOne panel excluding BRCA1, BRCA2, ATM, BAP1, MSH2, PALB2, and BRIP1 without high TMB

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cohort 3: Patients without one of the selected DNA repair gene alterations as per FoundationOne FoundationOne®CDx (F1CDx) panel.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cohort 3: Patients without one of the selected DNA repair gene alterations as per FoundationOne FoundationOne®CDx (F1CDx) panel.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A laboratory test result that indicates the status of a molecular genetic or cytogenetic event in a pathologic process._A research study that compares a particular outcome (such as lung cancer) in groups of individuals who are alike in many ways but differ by a certain characteristic (for example, female nurses who smoke compared with those who do not smoke)._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory test result that indicates the status of a molecular genetic or cytogenetic event in a pathologic process.

A research study that compares a particular outcome (such as lung cancer) in groups of individuals who are alike in many ways but differ by a certain characteristic (for example, female nurses who smoke compared with those who do not smoke).
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
